newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE white sugar ends hardly changed, dull.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE white sugar ends hardly changed, dull.

text.p: LIFFE sugar futures ended mostly just easier after trading in a narrow range with nothing to give the market new direction.
March last traded at $298.00 which was down just 10 cents on volume of 990 lots. May was down 60 cents at $297.60 on volume of 1107 lots. Total volume at that point was 1,886 lots.
"There was a bit of pre-restitution selling early in the day," said one trader, referring to the EU's sugar tender Wednesday.
But New York's performance helped bring LIFFE futures up later in the day, he said.

The European Union's sugar management committee will discuss the final sugar balance sheet for 1995/96 on Wednesday, an EU official said on Monday. The committee will also discuss the provisional balance sheet for 1996/97, the official said.
Pankobirlik, an influential union of Turkish sugar beet cooperatives, expected 2.05 million tonnes of overall sugar production in 1997/98, up from 1.85 million tonnes in 1996/97, it said in a report.

Turkey's state-run sugar refinery Turkseker is planning to export 50,000 tonnes of sugar soon, its general manager Selahhatin Hun said on Tuesday. "We are planning to sell about 50,000 tonnes more after our first sale two weeks ago," Hun told Reuters.
Mexican sugar cane growers, threatening to stage a "down machetes" strike against industrialists, won a 26 percent increase in cane prices, daily newspaper Reforma said Tuesday.
